definition: ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.chinese: 中國長號大號協會理事。

sentences.english: Given all this, they did not exactly need their art to be bummer too.
sentences.chinese: 鑑於這一切，他們不正是需要他們的藝術是長號太多。

sentences.english: In this style of music , the trumpet , clarinet , and trombone form the basis of instrumentation.
sentences.chinese: 這種新樂風演奏的基本樂器包括小號，黑管和長號。

sentences.english: This is Phantom of the Opera on Leaf Trombone .
sentences.chinese: 這是“葉子長號上的歌劇魅影”。

sentences.english: The site provides the musicians' names and a photo of the lead trombonist.
sentences.chinese: 網頁提供了音樂家們的名字和一張首席長號手的照片。

sentences.english: There are some wonderful trumpet and trombone solos in the piece.
sentences.chinese: 這支樂曲中有一些美妙的小號和長號的獨奏。

definition: in perfect harmony/in sync/lit. qin and se sing in harmony
lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
to perform music/to play a tune
to negotiate the transfer of personnel
Jianzhen or Ganjin (688-763), Tang dynastic Buddhist monk, who crossed to Japan after several unsuccessful attempts, influential in Japanese Buddhism
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
